intro: Lagenithrix, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, pale purple to white flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. Lagenithrix is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which contribute to its ornamental appeal.
